paper_abstract: A proper vertex coloring of a graph is called linear if the subgraph induced by the vertices colored by any two colors is a set of vertex-disjoint paths. The linear chromatic number of a graph G, denoted by lc(G), is the minimum number of colors in a linear coloring of G. In this paper, we show lc(G) <= Delta(G) + 7 for a planar graph G with maximum degree Delta(G). (C) 2012 Elsevier B.V All rights reserved.
paper_title: A result on linear coloring of planar graphs
